channel.title: Why do servers circulate around donating?
channel.description:
I've noticed servers feature in there advertisements, something like, donor island!, donor points!, donators get this!, donators get that!, it's honestly annoying as it shows greed from the owners.
Opinions?

item.title: Why do servers circulate around donating?
item.dc:creator: @ranger_squad ranger squad
item.description:
@ranger_squad wrote:

JavaTC:

Cheap Webhost with domain name: About $10 a month Source: Bluehost

http://www.one.com/en/

Less than $1 a month for a 5gb webhost and domain name. I used it for over two years and never had a problem.

Read full topic
item.source: Why do servers circulate around donating?

item.title: Why do servers circulate around donating?
item.dc:creator: @doom_j doom_j
item.description:
@doom_j wrote:

Money equals bigger dedicated server, which equals more players, which equals more money!

Read full topic
item.source: Why do servers circulate around donating?

item.title: Why do servers circulate around donating?
item.dc:creator: @arham_4 arham 4
item.description:
@arham_4 wrote:

[quote=“TimeTM, post:43, topic:452134”]Usually the money they receive from donations are used for the server

  • Virutal Server / Dedicated server (Depending on the income)
  • Webhost
  • Advertisement (If they buy from the right sponsors, they can easily get to spent over a thousand dollars a month for this
  • In some cases, developers (General server / client / website developing)

The rest of the money goes in the pucket if there’s any left.
I don’t quite see the problem about this it’s their server not yours, let them use their income on what they want. If you don’t like the server because you’re butthurt about them getting a good income then don’t play.

End of story.[/quote]

why do they circulate around donating? A better question is why would you HOST a server if you don’t plan to make money.

You are not getting the point of this topic. I’m asking why do they mention donator features in there topics, and everything you do, donate now!, and when you talk to an owner, “You should donate. Awzum features!”.

They circulate there whole server around donating, not the game, just the money.

Read full topic
item.source: Why do servers circulate around donating?

item.title: Why do servers circulate around donating?
item.dc:creator: @runescape_sucks runescape sucks
item.description:
@runescape_sucks wrote:

Mainly because I can’t take donations.
Even if I could, I would probably take DONATIONS, and not offer anything in return, except a better, more stable server.

Read full topic
item.source: Why do servers circulate around donating?

item.title: Why do servers circulate around donating?
item.dc:creator: @runescape_sucks runescape sucks
item.description:
@runescape_sucks wrote:

why do they circulate around donating? A better question is why would you HOST a server if you don’t plan to make money.

I don’t take donations, I have in the past, but I find that money makes me greedy, so I start just giving people whatever they want. So I wouldn’t host for donations.

I use free things, I’ve never payed for a domain, a VPS, or anything like that.

I think people take donations for either themselves, or to better the server.

Read full topic
item.source: Why do servers circulate around donating?

item.title: Why do servers circulate around donating?
item.dc:creator: @TimeTM TimeTM
item.description:
@TimeTM wrote:

Usually the money they receive from donations are used for the server

  • Virutal Server / Dedicated server (Depending on the income)
  • Webhost
  • Advertisement (If they buy from the right sponsors, they can easily get to spent over a thousand dollars a month for this
  • In some cases, developers (General server / client / website developing)

The rest of the money goes in the pucket if there’s any left.
I don’t quite see the problem about this it’s their server not yours, let them use their income on what they want. If you don’t like the server because you’re butthurt about them getting a good income then don’t play.

End of story.

Read full topic
item.source: Why do servers circulate around donating?

item.title: Why do servers circulate around donating?
item.dc:creator: @arham_4 arham 4
item.description:
@arham_4 wrote:

[quote=“wildskiller, post:41, topic:452134”][quote author=eyeownyew link=topic=555013.msg4074360#msg4074360 date=1344653474]

Well, a lot of the time, people make more money doing it illegally than legal business.

If you’re willing to take the risks, it means you’re greedy (or in the case of the black market in third world countries, desperately poor).
In America, people who have a decent wage and still want more money are usually greedy. People who are making more money than necessary can be considered greedy.
[/quote]

I actually am poor, because we don’t beg, we’re not into anything illegal, and my mom’s an idiot. I just know what my friends and my mom’s boyfriends have done. It’s the easy way around money, which I wont get until I get a job, in 2 years (hoping).[/quote]

Read full topic
item.source: Why do servers circulate around donating?

item.description:

[quote=“eyeownyew, post:36, topic:452134”][quote author=wildskiller link=topic=555013.msg4074332#msg4074332 date=1344651001]

It’s not greedy, it’s good buisness.

Business != Illegally hosting a private server

Business < Illegal Business
[/quote]

Jail < Freedom

Don’t be so retarded.[/quote]I’d take jail any day. At least in there education is FREE

item.title: Why do servers circulate around donating?
item.dc:creator: @RandQm RandQm
item.description:
@RandQm wrote:

I have always said to myself, I would once host a server where people would donate because they like the gameplay and want to help paying the vps to keep the server online.

I never took the risk to host though, since I have a feeling that kids nowadays just want those items and bonusses and not the gameplay.
So I’m not going to invest in it.

Read full topic

item.title: Why do servers circulate around donating?
item.dc:creator: @wildskiller wildskiller
item.description:
@wildskiller wrote:

Loveandpower:

I have never supported making money from rsps. It should purely be about the experience and the learning. No programmer can ever say they haven’t learned at least ONE THING from hosting a server, whether or not it’s physically language related or not.

I’ve never cared about donations, that’s why I’m so poor

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @eyeownyew Eyeownyew

item.source: Why do servers circulate around donating?

item.title: Why do servers circulate around donating?
item.dc:creator: @halflive9 halflive9
item.description:
@halflive9 wrote:

I think your banner shouldn’t be advertising the donator part of your server. I don’t think a lot of people that wants to spend money will search through a toplist and pick the one with the most donator benefits. People will start donating as they find out that your server is good and when they want some little extras that a donator spot will give them. My opinion is that a server can offer donator spots and use that money to keep the server running and pay for forums ect.

Read full topic
item.source: Why do servers circulate around donating?

item.title: Why do servers circulate around donating?
item.dc:creator: @kingman002 kingman002
item.description:
@kingman002 wrote:

I think servers should go as far as giving a special island for donators. With stuff like an extra rune rock, couple magic trees, anvil, smelter, ect. Donating for special items or needing donator to wear stuff like ags, torva, and claws, is bs. It’s also bs when a server still uses a free webhost like .tk when they probably get more than they need for one like .com

People probably do it because they don’t have money for something they want so they do something so simple: leech a server, get a free forum, add donating features, change home, ect so they can buy it.

Read full topic

item.source: Why do servers circulate around donating?

item.title: Why do servers circulate around donating?
item.dc:creator: @Tutorial Tutorial
item.description:
@Tutorial wrote:

I have a job and everything, so I can pretty much support the server and webhosting funds. There will be a donator feature on my server, but it will only be used for development needs. Most of the servers these days that offer donation systems are run by people that cannot afford to keep it up, or people that just do a one month stand to make the money and ditch the project.

Read full topic
item.source: Why do servers circulate around donating?
